casebody.data:
MAHONING COUNTY BAR ASSOCIATION
v.
MCNALLY. No. 2017-1743 Supreme Court of Ohio. Submitted April 8, 2019
Decided April 9, 2019

{¶ 3} Therefore, it is ordered by this court that respondent is reinstated to the practice of law in the state of Ohio.

{¶ 5} For earlier case, see Mahoning Cty. Bar Assn. v. McNally , 154 Ohio St.3d 292, 2018-Ohio-3719, 114 N.E.3d 147.

O'Connor, C.J., and Kennedy, French, Fischer, DeWine, Donnelly, and Stewart, JJ., concur.

*1293{¶ 1} This cause came on for further consideration upon the filing of an application for reinstatement by respondent, John Aloysius McNally IV, Attorney Registration No. 0067328, last known business address in Youngstown, Ohio.

{¶ 2} The court coming now to consider its order of September 18, 2018, wherein the court, pursuant to Gov.Bar R. V(12)(A)(3), suspended respondent for a period of one year, with six months stayed on condition, finds that respondent has substantially complied with that order and with the provisions of Gov.Bar R. V(24).

{¶ 4} It is further ordered that the clerk of this court issue certified copies of this order as provided for in Gov.Bar R. V(17)(D)(1) and that publication be made as provided for in Gov.Bar R. V(17)(D)(2).
